skillTree.localised_description: The turbulent Winds of Magic can do little harm to those who have found harmony amidst its raging currents.
The best way to repel the chaotic flurry of missile fire is to meet it with order, discipline, and a stalwart row of shields.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

Passive ability: "Aura of Majesty"
	(in dragon form)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: There must be order in all things, and from that order, harmony.
The Storm Dragon's spine must remain steadfast against every looming threat that lies beyond it.

effects.description: Construction cost: -40% for Great Bastion buildings

skillTree.localised_description: There is no rest in the midst of battle, only the seething storm of relentless aggression.

effects.description: Cooldown: -25% to Lore of Life spells
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Earth Blood Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Regrowth Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Miao Ying stands vigilant against the armies of Ruin, for Order is the only true answer to Chaos.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +10 when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Daemons of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 4% when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Daemons of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When an enemy thinks they are safe at range, it is best to prove them wrong.
When defending the Great Bastion, one must follow up a missile volley immediately with another.

effects.description:
Ability: "Eye of the Storm"
	(in dragon form)

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
What weapons can hope to pierce the rigid scales of such a monstrous and majestic beast?
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A rampage of talons and teeth will carve through the heart of any foe.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The Storm Dragon's every movement is imbued with a predatory swiftness and grace.
Miao Ying is trusted above all to guard the north, serving as Cathay's most steadfast champion.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached

skillTree.localised_description: This spell temporarily transforms allies' mortal flesh into unbreakable rock, increasing tenfold their resistance to attack.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Dragon Emperor guides every sword and spear of the norther provinces, inspiring a strength of arms to match an unflinching strength of will.

skillTree.localised_description: From lowly peasant to expert marksman, every arrow of the east soars with a Draconic power and grace.

skillTree.localised_description: Ancient Cathay stands historically unconquered. Booming cannons and rockets of exploding fire help ensure it will remain so.

skillTree.localised_description: Cathayan armies have been tested time and again, their skills proven in a tumultuous arena of bloodshed and near-constant war.

skillTree.localised_description: A blanket of glowing lights amidst the clouds is sure to stir the heart of every Cathayan warrior beneath them.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
All warriors of honour and pride are eager to fight under the Dragon-Emperor's banners.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Every wound that is not fatal is but a lesson to learn from.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: The blood-soaked battlefields of the northern provinces are the proving grounds upon which the mightiest warriors of Cathay have honed their craft.

	(Lord's army)
